Key Match Events: Jack Grealish netted the opener before Trent Alexander-Arnold bagged the second and Declan Rice the third.
Fredrik Jensen missed a glorious chance to level the score for Finland.
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored an exceptional free-kick to double England's lead.
Ollie Watkins' surging run set up Declan Rice to make it three for England.
Arttu Hoskonen scored a late consolation goal for Finland from a corner.
Post-Match Reflections: Lee Carsley's side responded to their defeat against Greece with a solid win against Finland.
England's victory boosts their automatic promotion hopes from League B Group 2.
The match highlighted England's defensive troubles and reliance on Finland's poor finishing.
Trent Alexander-Arnold's performance was commendable despite playing out of position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Helsinki Olympic Stadium.
England went level on points with Greece but trailed on goal difference.
